attributes.action: Ensure universities give real & deserved support to students if lecturers strike
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of students are at risk of not receiving the much needed support from universities that they have paid for and deserve at a time when they have end of years examinations approaching, the results of which can have a detrimental impact of the degrees they aspire to.

In the Times on Saturday there was a small article dedicated to this entitled “Universities to ‘dumb down’ final exams amid walkouts”. This should receive far more attention and government intervention.
attributes.background: University lecturers are planning to strike in opposition to proposals to being made to change their pension arrangements at a time when many students are planning to sit end of year exams and/or submit papers to obtain their degrees. Universities are planning to reduce support and dumb down exams.

rejection.details: Support for students is the responsibility of universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.
